p: Interestingly, year of pre-historic and modern colonization show no effect on RRN on islands at a global scale. This lack of legacies of historic human colonization on current plant naturalization is surprising, because several studies have shown that long-term effects of historic socio-economic developments may be detectable for at least a century ( Essl et al. 2011 ), and that they are particularly pronounced for invasive plants ( Rouget et al. 2016 ). Most likely, more recent and pervasive changes in socio-economic pressures mask any potential signatures of early human colonization of islands on current RRN and RRI.
